column4: if you already have windows installed as long as you have a free patition to use on you system you can dual boot Ubuntu.  you can also run windows inside of ubuntu in vertualbox
What DGM sid
said
virtualbox.org
Even though ubuntu is already booting from grub?
DGM: well another disk is the same as having an available partition so can do.  the install of ubuntu detects the windows and asks if you want to dual boot
Yeah, sacarlson, I already have both ubuntu and windows installed
Exactly
How would one instal lilo now?
DGM so you want to virtuabox to autostart in windows or ubuntu.  is that what you want?
I'd have to do it from the real boot, correct?
no sacarlson
I have windows + grub on my primary harddrive
Ubuntu on my secondary
Interestingly, there is heaps of documentation for doing it the other way around
DGM oh that would be cool but I think the file structure of virtualbox is different but maybe you could or at least convert what was there into it.
wat
No
I'm not creating a virtual machine
I'm using the actual disk
VirtualBox also has an option of embedding a custom MBR in the disk access file. Would that be an alternative solution?
Or would I still need grub/lilo?
DGM:  well I think I may be way off but I have done a netboot or pxe_boot with virtualbox that used the partition and files direct from the host that it was runing on.  Am I close?
